p: Arthropod-borne viruses (arboviruses) are transmitted via vectors, can affect both animals and humans [ 1]. Globally, vector-borne diseases are responsible for more than 20% of the infectious diseases affecting all humanity worldwide, most commonly in the developing countries in Africa and Asia; many African communities suffer from vector-borne disease burden and its socioeconomic consequences [ 2– 5]. Mosquito-borne viruses affecting humans, these viruses include: chikungunya (CHIKV), dengue fever (DFV), yellow fever (YFV), Rift Valley fever virus (RVFV), Sindbis virus (SINV), and alkhurma viruses [ 2, 6– 9].
